abstract: CBS’s sci-fi show “Jericho” limped across the finish line Tuesday, earning just under 6 million viewers in its series-finale, according to Nielsen’s estimates. “Jericho” — which was canceled last spring, revived over the summer after an outcry from devoted fans, and then canceled once again — finished third in its 10 p.m. time slot behind ABC’s “Primetime” (10.4 million) and a repeat of NBC’s “Law & Order: Special Victims Unit” (8.5 million).
lead_paragraph: CBS’s sci-fi show “Jericho” limped across the finish line Tuesday, earning just under 6 million viewers in its series-finale, according to Nielsen’s estimates. “Jericho” — which was canceled last spring, revived over the summer after an outcry from devoted fans, and then canceled once again — finished third in its 10 p.m. time slot behind ABC’s “Primetime” (10.4 million) and a repeat of NBC’s “Law & Order: Special Victims Unit” (8.5 million).

headline.main: ‘Jericho’ Goes Out With a Ratings Whimper
